data.text: I can't believe the plate's gone...
C'mon, dear, we gotta keep moving.
Didn't believe 'em at first, but they kept screaming at us to evacuate...
We'd be dead if it wasn't for that man.
What the hell's going on?
Tell me this isn't happening. I've got a friend in Sector 7!
I heard it was another bombing.
Don't tell me─it was Avalanche.
I...I've lost...everything...
What am I supposed to do now?
I know you're scared.
But we need to find a place to sleep.
Sector 7 is just...gone...
I know it looks bad, but there's gotta be some survivors.
I wouldn't count on it...
We could help people.
Don't be an idiot. You'd probably get yourself killed.
So you're gonna stand around and what!?
You think I don't wanna help!?
Are you okay Grandma?
Let's all of us rest for a bit.
I-I'm so sorry. I just can't seem to stop shaking.
Don't be sorry, Mom. Everything's gonna be just fine. I promise.
But out here, we're safe...right?
My leg's pretty messed up. I don't think I can go any farther.
It just fell out of the sky...
Is this for real...?
'Fraid it is.
An accident?
Dunno, but there was gunfire...
The plates aren't supposed to fall like that...
We built it to last, so...how did it happen?
Remember that customer from the other day? He was from Sector 7.
You think he's okay?
I certainly hope so.
I don't know if I can work right now...
Take off all the time you need.
I heard it was Avalanche that did it.
Figures. Radicals like them'll never stop─just gotta kill 'em.
Shinra needs our support now, more than ever.
Goddamn Avalanche... They'll pay for this.
If it's Shinra they're after, then leave us out of it. We don't deserve this.
Scum-sucking cowards don't care who they hurt.
Mom... Dad... Don't leave me...
Hey, you can't give up hope.
I have to find them right now!
Are you crazy? What about your child─their grandchild!?
Can't even imagine fallin' that far...
You stop it with that talk. I don't even wanna think about it.
Maybe us humans weren't meant to build such big buildings, you know?
The next plate'll be much sturdier, you'll see. Shinra'll make sure of it.
It's like there's a hole in the sky.
Like someone popped the lid off our world.
Man, I can't believe what I'm seeing here...
How long you think it'll be before we put a new plate up?
Gotta feel for the platies whose world came crashing down.
I feel a little more for the folks who lived under their world.
It's terrible for everyone.
Having the ground fall right out from under you like that...
So what's going to happen now?
The other plates will hold...right?
Don't you worry, they'll be fine. Every plate's got its own supports you know.
But if every plate has the same design, then if it happened to one...
Well, yeah...
So other plates could just...come down at any moment?
What happened to Sector 7 was no accident. Someone dropped that plate on purpose.
Whoa, someone forget a plate!?
Damn, how much you had to drink, son? We ain't missing no plate!
I'm telling you, that quake I felt...
Ain't no quakes neither, just you being a drunken asshole!
Hey looky there, ain't that open sky over Sector 7?
Get your head outta the bottle, man! Ain't nothing up there but steel, steel, and more steel!
I'm stone-cold sober, man. I'm tellin' you─the plate's gone!
They said it was Avalanche again.
How could they kill so many innocent people?
Shinra really needs to round them all up.
They deserve everything that's coming their way.
How sick in the head do you have to be to destroy a whole plate?
They're not sane, I know that much.
Are you okay?
Yeah, it's just... When I think about what all those poor people must be going through I...
How did the world get...get so screwed up?
Wish I knew...
Real disaster we got here.
We shouldn't just sit around here talking about it. We can help!
Yeah! Not like we got jobs or nothing.
What sorta supplies we gonna need?
Meds, I reckon─lots of 'em. Much as we can carry!
Took us ages to build it, but in an instant...
You don't think this is our fault?
Even if we screwed up, we were just following the foreman's orders.
Will we really go to all the effort to build a new one?
That, or they'll write off the whole damn sector like before.
I heard it wasn't an accident.
Then what was it? An attack?
What kinda monsters'd do something so awful?
Monsters with a few screws loose.
Refugees'll start pouring in any minute now.
Mostlike, yeah. We need to be ready for them.
They'll need a place to clean up, won't they?
Drinking water. Food too. Oh, can't forget blankets.
Yo, if there was ever a time to strike...
Yeah! We ain't gonna get a better chance.
It's bedlam in Sector 7, man. We could clean up, and no one'd be the wiser!
All that treasure in those parts is ours for the taking!
And we could "help" the injured while we're at it. Win-win!
Man, I was scared shitless.
Legit paralyzed with fear─I'm serious!
What's with all these soldiers in the streets all of a sudden?
Wait─you don't think Avalanche is here, do you?
Mom, Sis...
My whole family...
She...had family in the Sector 7 slums.
I'll pray for them.
Everyone who had family back in Sector 7 is devastated.
Who wouldn't be?
Wanna believe there's something we can do for them but...
I'd probably be under that plate along with the rest of 'em if you hadn't asked me out.
Glad you said yes.
I owe you my life, babe.
Everything I've ever known is gone─gone with that plate.
You still have me.
Thank you.
Whatcha doing here at a time like this?

Stop it, please. You can't blame yourself.
The plate─it's really gone! I thought it was a joke.
Something's not right with the world today...
What does this mean for Midgar's future?
This kind of thing isn't supposed to happen. I thought the war was over...
I remember this feeling. It was like this before the last one started...
I don't even wanna think about it!
And now breaking news.

There was this rumbling, and then all of a sudden...
My heart is still pounding.

I felt the shaking, but don't remember an explosion...
It's like everybody's talking about it.
Well of course they are. I'm sure it gave everyone a right scare.

I'm sure we'll be fine if we stick together.
That's not going to keep either of us from getting smashed like a pancake.
Trust me. I'm not gonna let anyone or anything hurt you.

Could you take this seriously for like five seconds?
Babe, when it comes to you, I'm always serious.
Think this road's still good?
You remember how we used to play around here?
Never would've crossed our minds back then that a plate could drop out of the sky.
Things were simpler, that's for sure. Didn't have a care in the world.
Didn't have to think about paychecks, or rent, or where the next meal's coming from.
But those days are long gone.
Pretty sure this oughta take us straight to the Sector 5 slums.
Gonna be tough going for the kids and old folks though.
Hey guys, we'll rest here for the night. Start back up at first light, okay?

And if there's anything you need, don't hesitate to ask.

Yeah, there is: rest and don't get underfoot. We don't wanna make more work for 'em.
But the watch... They need sleep too.
You resting'll help put them at ease, all right? So do that.
I'm just too old for this.
So many young lives, gone, but me...
We're not sleeping here, are we?
Better than an all-night march, ain't it?
Finally, a break. These watch guys don't mess around, I tell you.
Would you please stop complaining?
If they hadn't helped us, we'd be buried under a ton of rubble.
So where do we go now?
I've got an aunt in Sector 2...
Hope my neighbors made it out.
Maybe they hooked up with another group...?
Damn this leg of mine...
Think you can make it as far as Sector 3?
I'm so sorry, Dad. It's my fault you got hurt.
I'll be right as rain with a bit of rest.
You wait here, and I'll go on ahead─find us a chocobo carriage.
No, don't. You know we can't spare the gil.
How much further till we reach Sector 1?
We've still got a long way to go. Think you can manage?
Not like I've got a choice. We don't have a home to go back to.
Let's stop here for the day.
Wish it was just a bad dream...
I'd give anything to wake up...
My husband...
We're supposed to sleep here on the cold, hard ground?
I'm dying of thirst here...
Where's Daddy?
He'll be back in a little bit...
And where's Brother?
He's...with Daddy.
God...damn it!
Shit! Thing won't even budge.
Goddamn it all! My family didn't deserve this.
You find your friends?
Not yet...
You...wanna look some more?
You know, they probably got evacuated somewhere...probably.
Goddamn. This thing fell all that way?
It's a miracle anyone survived.
What happened to all the people that were living on the plate...
Uh...whadda you think happened?
Are the others okay?
I don't know...
I'm...sure they made it out in time.
God I hope you're right...
Not gonna make it into work anytime soon, so might as well drink.
The office must be crazy right now, what with everyone dealing with this.
Thanks to that stupid plate, everyone's gonna find out I was in Wall Market!
I told the boss I'm "visiting family."
Damn, I should've thought of that.
And now the latest on last night's terrible tragedy: the collapse of the Sector 7 plate.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: At an emergency press conference held by Shinra earlier...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: representatives confirmed that the collapse was orchestrated by the eco-terrorist group known as Avalanche.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: This same group is also believed to be responsible for the bombings of Mako Reactor 1 and 5. In light of this connection...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: security has been raised citywide.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Furthermore, representatives stated that Avalanche may have close ties to Wutai...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: and that Shinra will perform a thorough investigation to determine the extent of the nation's involvement.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: At this time, multiple evacuation zones have been established throughout the city.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Access to Sector 7 is currently restricted to emergency responders.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: As inspections of other support structures have yielded no irregularities, the interplate travel ban has been lifted.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: However, all Midgar rail service will remain suspended until thorough safety checks have been completed.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Screw you, Avalanche!
They're gonna pay for what they did to our city.
Down with Wutai!
Goddamn Avalanche... They all deserve to die!
Buncha psychopaths trying to kill us all!
I bet they're coming for us next.
I say we track the bastards down first!
Bet you can spot them by their Wutai clothing!
They didn't mention the undercity even once!
I hate being left in the dark like this.
Just a little further.
I'm...feeling woozy. Can't even see straight.
There's a doctor in Sector 5. They'll patch you up.
Food's what I need right now, not meds.
You have somewhere to go?
Sector 4. I've got family there.
That's still a ways from here, though.
Come to my restaurant. It ain't much, but you'll get a warm meal.
You'd do that for me...?
Only got soup to offer, though.
That's plenty, sir. Thank you. I haven't eaten since yesterday.
The trains haven't been running for days now. We're all screwed.
Goddamn Avalanche... They're to blame for this mess.
When are we gonna be able to get topside again?
I just want to get the hell out of this...this pit.
Poor chocobos're scared to death.
Can hardly blame them for that...
They don't have the foggiest idea what's going on around here, poor things.
It's our job to protect and care for 'em.
We're so close to Sector 5 and yet...I'm so tired.
Well, we did walk and walk all night.
I can barely...keep my eyes...open...
If you can sleep, now's the time.
But when I close my eyes, all the horrible memories start flooding back.
I-I can't...breathe...
You okay?
It's a panic attack. It'll pass.
Happened to me before, too. You're gonna be fine. Just...breathe. In and out...
See? Much better.
Yeah...thank you...
Think we all could use a break.
I'm too exhausted to help anybody...
Hey. Deadweight is the last thing we need.
Save your strength. People are gonna need all the help we can offer.
Can't even recall the last time we went to Sector 7.
Remember how we used to sneak out of the House?
Dunno where the gang all ended up, but I hope they're safe.
What I wouldn't give to sleep in a bed...
and wake up to find this was all just a horrible dream.
This is a million times harder without my glasses.
But at least this way I can't see how bad it is. Ignorance is bliss.
It hurts to even talk right now.
But if I stop talking, I start remembering...
I've got a brother in the Sector 5 slums.
We're on the outs, but...he wouldn't turn away his own sister...
Whaddya say? Wanna go to Sector 7?
I do wanna help out where I can, but...
I get it. It's scary...
And it's not safe neither. They say stuff is still falling.
Bet there's looting going on. People stealing everything.
It's sick. Who would do that!?
Victims. I'd sooner judge Avalanche.
That's it. I can't walk anymore.
Really should've exercised more when I was younger.
You dears go on ahead. We're going to stop to catch our breath. We won't be long, I promise.
We're not leaving you behind. We're staying too.
We could all do with a little break.
That's right. Everyone's feeling beat.
Hold on─I'll fix us something to eat.
I'll take a look around, see if any inns are open.
Can't believe our luck. Thought for sure we'd be able to meet the don.
Now now, it's still early. Might be he's asleep.
Are you sure you're okay with this?
I mean, what choice do we have? And we'll be set for life if he picks me for his bride.
Might be different if we could get a loan but...
I'm sorry... I'll find work soon, I promise.
Really, it's fine. Let me do this. Then we won't have to worry about money.
We're opening our doors extra early today.
We're expecting a lot of hungry refugees to pour in.
Lotta noise up at the don's place earlier. What was that about?
Little strange how quiet it is now, too...
All those waiting to enter the Honeybee Inn, please form a line!
data.speaker: Receptionist

data.text: If you leave the line, you forfeit your place. Also, you cannot save a spot for friends!
data.speaker: Receptionist

data.text: Guess who's first. This guy!
All those heartbroken honeygirls... I'll cheer 'em up!
Yeah, I know how pathetic it looks, lining up first thing in the morning, but it beats sitting at home thinking too much.
Sometimes you gotta have fun─remember that life's for living.
Shit... Should've gotten here earlier.
But I had to make sure her gift was perfectly wrapped.
It me or it more crowded than usual?
People wanna forget their troubles, now more than ever.
I don't wanna think about anything, you know?
Yeah, I can't be alone. My mind goes places I don't wanna.
Wow, would you look at that line. Our regulars are up with the sun.
I thought for sure we wouldn't get any customers today, but man was I wrong.
I'm still feeling pretty shaken up. Guess sleep isn't the cure for everything.
You feel that tremor just now? No?
Service with a genuine smile can make all the difference.
Gotta do what I can to help the people get their minds off it.
Nothing beats that first drink after work!
Post-work? You comin' off a night shift buddy?
Nah, but it damn well felt like work, cleaning up all that shit that fell.
So why're you drinking this early?
Got no work on account of what happened, so, hell─figured I'd start early.
I don't know if I can ever go back there...
Thought a little liquid courage'd help me make the trip, but I'm not feeling it.
I wanted to buy my friend some new clothes, since he lost all of his.
All he's got are the clothes on his back, and he can't wear those forever.
We're open early today, in light of what happened.
data.speaker: Clothing Store Owner's Son

data.text: Wanted to give those who evacuated a change to get a new set of clothes.
data.speaker: Clothing Store Owner's Son

data.text: See all those Shinra troopers storming the don's place? What's that about?
Hey, you think it's got something to do with the plate collapse?
You hear? The don's place is empty─everybody's gone.
Word on the street is that Shinra troopers raided it.
Bet you anything all them assholes are dead or in cuffs.
The don, too? What's gonna happen to this town without him?
Now here's what I wanna know: with no don, who's gonna run the show?
Well, Kotch or Scotch, I'm guessin'?
Not necessarily. Maybe Shinra'll swoop in and take over.
If the suits are in control, then we can kiss Wall Market goodbye.
Can't remember the last time I came here.
Hasn't changed one bit.
Hope the loan sharks don't recognize us...
Think the shop'll take me back on? Worth asking, right?
If the shop's still around, that is.
I don't want to raise our child in a place like this.
We can't afford to be picky right now.
There are robberies and kidnappings and god knows what other crimes.
The watch'll keep us safe, we'll be fine.
I'll admit, it's kind of strange coming to this place at this time of day.
Town only really comes alive at night. Could've sworn the people here were all nocturnal.
Figured I'd go my whole life without coming to this town.
I just hope we can find beds and work for the both of us.
Wall Market at last.
Looking at this place, you'd never know a plate fell next door.
Hope they're taking refugees.
Wish we were here under different circumstances.
Never thought I'd come here myself.
It's not as bad as people make it out.
Wait...you've been here before?
I grew up in this town.
Look─see that crowd over there? You think they're all Sector 7 refugees?
Guess a lot more people made it out than I thought.
The colosseum is open for business and hungry for fresh meat! So step right up and try your luck!
What better way to inspire others than with a display of martial prowess?
Are you our next champion?
Hey there, champ!
You up for a match or three?
Wonder what the collapse means for the fights.
I'm gonna have to bet smart today.
Been looking forward to today's match for a while.
Being sad 'n' shit isn't gonna help anybody.
It's the champ!
Wait a second. What happened to your old partner?
Tryin' to sleep here...
Still no trains, fantastic...
Man, how long did it take to get them running again last time?
Nigh on a full day.
What happened with that, anyway? They catch Avalanche?
No, but it's only a matter of time.
First it was the reactors, now the plates...
Those poor Shinra people. How tough they must have it, dealing with all this nonsense.
Until Avalanche is stopped, it's only gonna get worse.
You don't think our plate will fall, do you?
No, not with all the new security they've got.
Makes you wonder, though... They got enough people to watch all the pillars and reactors?
I think it's time we cut our losses.
But how else are we supposed to get topside?
Hey, I'm getting kinda sleepy...
Even if we get topside, they could still turn us away, you know.
I'll talk with my boss─explain the situation.
Sure─if the trains ever start running again, that is.
My head is spinning.
I haven't slept a wink since yesterday.
The trains still aren't running?
Man... How am I supposed to make rent this month if I keep missing work?
Well? Keep waiting or go home?
Home might be the better option. At this rate, they'll probably use the trains as shelters.
Are all these people planning on waiting here all day?
I think they just don't wanna be alone right now.
Hey there. Are you alone?
Everything's gonna be all right. I'll stay with you, okay?
So if we get topside, what then?
We go to the Shinra Building. It's the safest place in all of Midgar.
And if the train never shows up? What then?
Then...we go to Wall Market. No risk of any plates falling on us there.
Please...please be alive...
The hell with me, just...just spare my wife and daughter.
And I was looking forward to my first train...
You know how many allowances this one stupid ticket cost me?
What's the world coming to...?
I had some good friends in the Sector 7 undercity.
Say, you think they'll want to build a new plate?
Might mean jobs for us if they do. We built the originals, after all.
I'm too old for heavy lifting, but...I know things.
And to think it's not even the first time a plate fell...
Feels like the longer you're on this planet, the more sadness you wind up shouldering...
I have a daughter living up top in Sector 7.
I just wanna know that she's okay.
Couldn't've picked a worse time to shut the trains down.
Easy there. Shinra's working on getting things back up and running. Just be patient, ya hear?
We could be using these trains to deliver relief supplies!
Shinra's got plenty of helicopters to deliver food and water, remember?
You think they'll turn the train stations into shelters? They'd be perfect for it.
Works for me, so long as I get a roof over my head.
So, what's the plan after we rest up?
I was thinking of hitting up some family topside, but looks like that's not gonna happen.
I've got a sister who lives topside...in Sector 7.
I can't believe it. I won't believe it...not until I see the plate with my own two eyes...
Just when I thought that ugliness with the reactors was over...
Damn you, Avalanche. We built this city with our blood, sweat, and tears...
I didn't wanna stay at home alone─I wanted to distract myself with work, but...
I hope my coworkers made it out.
At least if the trains were running, the refugees'd be able to go topside.
But I bet it's just as bad up there as it is down here.
I've got no home to go back to, so I'm...I'm just gonna lie down here for a bit.
Sure hope to find things movin' again when I wake up.
So many lives lost. What a tragedy...
C'mon, dear. Let's pray for their souls.
How's it fair that we're still alive, when so many youngsters died? It ain't right.
It might not be fair, but we're alive, so we need to find a way to make ourselves useful.
I haven't been to the office in days now.
If I knew this was gonna happen, I would've shelled out the money and moved up top.
I can't believe this. I'm stuck down here again?
The slums don't wanna let you go.
I refuse to believe there's no other way up top.
Well, you could always walk along the tracks. Problem solved.
What? Don't be silly. We'd just end up delaying the trains even more.
Yelling at the station attendants is getting real old.
And it's not like screaming in their faces is gonna make the trains come any sooner.
Due to the plate collapse, train service has been suspended indefinitely.
We apologize for the inconvenience.
Once service resumes, only a limited number of trains will be running.
Please refrain from using them unless necessary.
Think we'll be waiting a while.
Even though we woke up early to make the first train.
It's my fault. I was stupid to think they'd be moving after all that.
I was really looking forward to a day of fun up there.
We can always plan another trip. After everything's settled down, we'll go.
Man, I'm hungry...
Guess my best bet would be to head back.
I can only hope the trains don't start running again. Ever.
Even if they do, I'm in no condition to work. Look at me.
We got this far, but what now?
I don't think the trains are gonna be moving for a while.
I'm hungry.
We'll be at Grandpa's soon, okay?
They're going to have so much food ready for us when we get there.
I'm about to keel over...
I just need a minute or two of shut-eye...
Dad looks pretty worn out...
He carried me on his back the whole way here.
May all those suffering find refuge...
And may the fallen find their way to the planet's loving embrace...
Come to think of it, I haven't seen Aerith around lately.
You don't need to worry about her. I'm sure she's out there, doing her part to help the wounded.
Please... Please spare my husband...
Don't take him from me... You can't, please don't...
I don't even know what to pray for anymore these days.
How did it come to this? Where did we go wrong?
Just let my son live through this, please.
Watch over our son. See that he's safe.
He worked so hard to get that job at Shinra, to move up top. His life was just beginning.
You'll see. He's just...real busy right now, that's all. We'll hear from him soon...
My wife and daughter went out looking for medicine for me.
Well, for my leg, specifically. It's in really bad shape right now...
This is Wall Market, by the look of it.
We were trying for Sector 8, though...
Come on, now. We're almost to Wall Market.
Is that where Daddy and Brother are?
Maybe...
Mommy? Are you crying?
No, sweetie. I'm fine.
Everyone─grab your stuff. We're heading out soon.
Take your time and walk at your own pace. There's no need to rush now.
Were you able to get any sleep?
Honey, did you have nightmares?
In my dreams, I saw it again. The plate, hurtling towards us.
Maybe...we should find a proper bed to sleep in tonight.
The watch managed to rustle us up some food, so I'm feelin' a little better thanks to that...
Think I've got enough energy now.
Five more minutes...
My brother, he...went back to Sector 7 to check on the house.
I really hope he's okay...
I thought there'd be more people here...
Everyone who got out ahead of us has probably moved on.
So we're the stragglers, huh? Hope there's still space in the shelters for us.
Well, we wouldn't have to worry about that if you hadn't decided to go back for your shit.
Hmph. It's not "shit"─this stuff could be the difference between life and death.
We've gotta help them. Somehow...
I just...I just gotta stay focused.
Phew! Looks a little better than before.
Alright, let's just start doing what we can.
Yeah, you're right. We can do this.
Wait. Are you crying?
You are too!
Now that that's been taken care of, things are looking a lot better around here.
I didn't know I could make such a big difference.
Not bad for a day's work.
Should we go back to the shelter?
The folks from Wall Market have brought us hot meals.
There's still a lot to be done, but let's not push ourselves too hard.
Remember to eat up so you have plenty of strength.
And get plenty of sleep too.
How far could they have gone?
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: Excuse me! You haven't seen any children wandering around, have you?
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: Oh, Cloud! Have you seen the kids around by any chance?
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: I haven't seen them since they left to do their patrols. I knew I should've told them to stay inside today.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: If you do happen to run into them somewhere, could you tell them to come back right away?
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: I can describe them if it'd help─
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: Don't worry. I'll know.
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: Just stay calm and wait here. Never know─they might come back on their own.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Okay?
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Yes, of course. Thank you so very much.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: Please come back safe and sound. Please.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: Thank you, I appreciate the help.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: Plates aren't supposed to just fall. I mean, what's going on up there?
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: Hey, Cloud.
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: Hmm. Gotta be one of them lost kids.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Lost? Who said we were lost? Stupid old man.
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: What'd you say?
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: What're you doing out here? And where's everyone else?
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: Oh, hey, Cloud.
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: Huh...when'd you start hanging out with little kids?
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Huh...when'd you start hanging out with stupid old men?
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: Hey!
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: What're you doing out here? And where's everyone else?
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: Well, we saw a bunch of tombstones lying on the ground, so we decided to stand them back up.
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: And then I heard laughing coming from somewhere, and when I turned around, everyone was gone. I was alone.
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: That! I heard that and everyone disappeared.
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: Heads up!
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: Guys!
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: Oates!
data.speaker: Boy

data.text: Look! Cloud's here too!
data.speaker: Boy

data.text: So why'd you kids come out all this way?
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: This is where our parents are. They're resting, but we wanted to say hi.
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: Sometimes you just wanna do that, you know?
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: ...I do.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Thanks so much for coming to find us! That's another one I owe ya!
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: We're gonna head back to the House now. Ms. Folia's probably pretty worried.
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: Hey Cloud, I found this on the ground. You should take it. I think it might come in handy!
data.speaker: Boy

data.text: Buncha little smart-asses...
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: With good hearts.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: The kids are back, I'm so relieved! Thank you for your help.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: I need to carry myself with more confidence. Or these kids are gonna walk all over me...
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: How ya doin', Cloud?
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: We'll protect the Sector 5 slums. Leave it to us!
data.speaker: Oates

data.text: Hey, you! Cloud, right?
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Man, am I glad I caught you. Sam─he told me who you are.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Said you're a merc, and a former SOLDIER at that!
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Listen, I hate to ask, but we've got a few runaway birds. Mind helping us find them?
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Poor things were so startled by that plate coming down, they just up and bolted.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: I'm sure they're around here somewhere, frightened and hungry.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: My poor birds...
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Worried about 'em huh? All right. I think we can help you out.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Oh, thank you! When you find them, feed them this.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: There's three missing all told, and their names are Coco, Lolo, and Momo.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: They'll come on home once they got some food in their bellies. Good luck. I'm counting on y'all.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Sure hope those birds are okay out there.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Man, I've been so worried, I haven't eaten a single thing since they ran off.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: What a time for them to bolt─when the people really need them.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: If only I'd kept a closer watch...
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Hey, look─Coco's back! I can't thank you enough.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Poor boy... He's easily the most skittish of the bunch. I was worried sick he might get hurt.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: ...But thank god he didn't.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Lolo here came back─thanks to you guys!
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: She's a spirited one, no doubt about that. Was half afraid she'd get into a fight with someone...
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: but she's none the worse for wear!
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Momo made it back! Can't thank you enough.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Silly ol' boy─always off in his own world. I was sure some monster'd catch him...
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: but I'm glad to see they didn't.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Well, that's all three missing birds! Dunno what I would've done without y'all!
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Now we can get back to business!
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Oh─and Sam wants you to swing by the stables when you can.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: I think he said something about wanting to "thank you properly."
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Kweh kweh.
data.speaker: Chocobo

data.text: Wark wark!
data.speaker: Chocobo

data.text: Wark wark.
data.speaker: Chocobo

data.text: Kweh kweh.
data.speaker: Chocobo

data.text: Kweh...?
data.speaker: Chocobo

data.text: Kweh!
data.speaker: Chocobo

data.text: Okay then! That makes three.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: We'd better check in at Sam's.
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text:
<color=yellow>Chocobo Search</color>

Return to Sam?
Thanks for agreeing to find my birds. You're a real saint.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: Someone said they heard a chocobo warking in one of them Sector 5 back alleys.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: Heard there's a chocobo out by the collapsed expressway.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: A chocobo was spotted near the old church.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: That's about all that's reached my ears.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: I'd bet good money those wandering birds are mine.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: It's just plain senseless, that's what it is...
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: You don't think my missing birds're hurt, do ya?
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: I got the finest chocobos Midgar's ever seen. I'm sure they'll be okay, but...
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: There's the champ with a heart of gold! My babies are all back home, safe and sound.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: Now I can finally get back to the business of business. Thanks, partner.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: Here, y'all earned this.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: It's a pass that'll get you a ride on one of my carriages whenever you need it─free of charge, of course. Not bad, am I right?
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: Chocobos're somethin' else. You can ride 'em, pet 'em, befriend 'em. What would we do without 'em?
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: They're the reason a guy like me can keep a roof over his head in a town like this─and that's no lie.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: I wouldn't blame ya for doubting that coming from me, but it is what it is.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: Anyhow, gotta make up for lost time.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: Question is, where to start.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: But hell, me and the birds've been through thick 'n' thin. We'll figure it out.
data.speaker: Sam

data.text: Oh, thank goodness! Been looking for y'all. You gotta help me. It's the chocobos... They've escaped, wouldn't you know!
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: Can't do a damn thing without those birds! We need 'em back real bad.
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: I'm begging ya. Ya gotta help me find my missing birds!
data.speaker: Stablehand

data.text: A moment of your time, good sir! Correct me if I'm wrong, but you're a mercenary, yes? The one I've heard so much about?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: It's you, my good merc! What brilliant timing you have!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Oh, hello there─it is a pleasure to meet you both. I'm a journalist for the Daily Buzz.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: The Daily Buzz? You mean that trash filled with Shinra fluff pieces?
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Well, yes, that's fair─but we do get a lot of inside information because of our close ties with the company.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Curious?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Here's the scoop. A certain division of Shinra─that shall remain nameless─was planning to seize Corneo's assets.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: But before they could, the key to his secret vault within which his misbegotten gains were securely tucked away...was stolen!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: And my sources tell me that the thief...is the undercity's beloved hero: the Angel of the Slums!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: The unidentified bandit who's been targeting anyone with ties to Shinra or Corneo! Yes, that Angel of the Slums!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: So? Do I have your undivided attention now?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Kinda, but hurry it up. We don't have time for a three-act play.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: That's all I needed to know! Here, you can have this.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: It's a map to the Angel's very own secret hideout.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: The unidentified bandit who's been targeting anyone with ties to Shinra or Corneo! Yes, that Angel of the Slums has struck again!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Well? Do I have your undivided attention now?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Kinda, but hurry it up. We don't have time for a three-act play.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Then I'll make this quick. So! My good merc.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: You do remember where the Angel's hideout is, right?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Do you remember the death threat she left there?
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: Oh, that. I've decided to seek the silver lining in this case.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: If the Angel of the Slums deigns to take an interest in a humble reporter, then that itself would be a story!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: ...What are you asking?
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: If you recover the stolen key, feel free to help yourself to the contents of Corneo's vault.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: All I want is knowledge─the identity of the Angel.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: So if you happen to learn anything of value, I'd be tremendously grateful to you if you passed it along.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: I'm dying to find out who the Angel of the Slums really is.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: It is a desire that transcends the professional! Could it be...love?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: If you learn anything at all, I demand that you tell me!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Oh, I know you. You're that merc, the one everyone in town's been talking about.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Take a deep breath and calm down, kiddo. I'm Mireille. Just another old woman who likes to talk and loves to listen.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Hey there, merc. Brought some friends today, I see.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Name's Mireille. Cloud and me, we... Well, let's just say we're recent acquaintances.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: What're you doing here?
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: Same thing as you, if I had to guess. Hunting for Don Corneo's fortune.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Now how'd you know about that?
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Well, there's nothing I love more than a good rumor. But I decided to fact-check this one myself.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Hate to burst your bubble, but it's not here.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: If the Angel of the Slums got to it first, then I'm guessing that gil's as good as gone.

data.text: Sounds like a reasonable assumption. But you know, that's not the rumor that's been making the rounds.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Humor me real quick. A question: Hypothetically, if you did manage to get your hands on this treasure, what do you think you would do with it?
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Easy. Make sure the people of Sector 7 had the means to get back on their feet. That's what.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: We'd use that creep's fortune to better the lives of everyone down here.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Hmm...
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Right, back to this rumor. Word on the street says the Angel doesn't have the key.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: If you want the full story, talk to Kyrie. She may be young, but she knows everything about everyone.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: She's easy to spot, too. Striped stockings, big hat. Girl doesn't exactly fit in.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Where is she?
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: Oh, who knows? I'm too old to keep up with kids her age these days.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: You understand.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: You won't find anything here. I checked.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Kyrie sticks out like a sore thumb. Look for striped stockings and a big ol' hat.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Ugh, that journalist's a real pain in the ass.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Okay then. Y'all think we got everything?
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Question is: now what?
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: It's not gonna be easy selling this stuff.
data.speaker: Barret

data.text: Oh, I know. What about Marle? We could ask her to help. I'm sure she'd be happy to.

It's like Avalanche made it their mission to make our lives a living hell.
How much you wanna bet our factory's shut down?
What? Why would it be closed?
I mean, just imagine. All the damage this caused...
I suppose I'll wait here till morning.
Never felt the ground move like that.
My ears're still ringing.
Was it an attack?
What is Avalanche thinking? What are they even after?
It's like they said on the news. They're just agents of Wutai!
If war breaks out again, I...I think I'm gonna enlist.
Well, if you do...then so will I.
So you'd really do it, huh? You'd join the military?
Did I say that...? Well, whatever. Ya wanna hit up Wall Market with me?
Look at all that smoke!
I didn't know that mako could burn like that...
It can't. It's the building that's burning.
First Reactor 1, now 5...
What's happening...?
Would you like a bowl of marche stew? The perfect blend of sweet and spicy!
All the fatty flavor and calories you need to get you through the day!
How about a bowl of stew for the road?
Gosh, this smell. Now it really feels like I'm back home, you know?
I get such bad cravings sometimes. It's the only thing missing from life up on the plate.
The Sector 5 undercity's specialty meatballs!
Try 'em with our sweet and spicy sauce!
Made with homegrown spices!
How many would you like?
Get your slum meatballs right here!
The sweet and spicy level's up to you!
Down a plate slathered in level fifty and get free chocobo candy!
Not a good day for business...
Can't sell shit if the trains don't bring me customers.
You know what I heard? Once you've become a regular, he'll let you try the level 100!
Wait, but is that sweet? Or spicy?
People say it's like an explosion of flavor beyond your wildest dreams.
I don't suppose you've heard anything about the reactor?
My boyfriend, he works there...
That Shinra guy with the shaved head... I've never seen someone so hot!
You should go talk to him next time.
I can't do that! I'd be way too nervous!
It's those sunglasses that do it. I wonder what his name is.
Why don't you just ask him?
Maybe, I dunno... Will you come with me if I do?
I should've gone up yesterday when I had the chance. I'll bet it's chaos in the annex.
Just try to calm down. I'm sure it'll all be fine.
I was swamped dealing with the shit from the 7-6 Annex, and now this?
Well, getting pissed ain't gonna fix anything.
Waited around for nothing.
But hey─now you've got all the time in the world.
Fancy meeting you here, merc. Ran outta work over in Sector 7, did ya?
Lotta folks round here are as old as the city itself.
Probably why things are so relaxed─peaceful.
A life here wouldn't be half bad, huh...
Hey, merc! If you're headin' to Sector 7, you're going the wrong way.
Hey, merc. Heard you've been putting in work here in Sector 5 as well.
Hey there. Word is you've done a damn good job helping out lotsa locals!
Ohh, I just don't know...
Maybe I'll check out what that other place has to offer.
And there go my meatballs. This is what I get for being so indecisive!
We've got the best spicy sweet meatballs in all Midgar!
Our secret sauce is the authentic meatball sauce!
Your kids'll just love our sweet and spicy mix. And for you parents, our spicy sweet sauce never fails to please!
How 'bout it? Buy one get one free!
Just closed for the day.
Come back tomorrow!
The Sector 5 slums are right there! God, I'm so nervous...
My very first undercity night out! Be cool!
D-did I just say that out loud?
The Sector 5 slums are right there! God, I'm so nervous...
A night out in the slums! What a treat!
I was born and raised topside, but nothing beats these slums.
Is it weird that I prefer this part of town?
It's got this energy, but it's still so chill.
The reactor just went up in flames, didn't it?
Avalanche must've used some heavy-duty explosives to do that kinda damage.
I wonder if they've got the reactor up and running again.
I wonder if Avalanche knows or cares about the grief they've caused.
We're patrolling for monsters.
No telling what kinda nasties the bombing might've riled up.
The station's just up ahead, but the trains still aren't moving.
We're patrolling for monsters.
I'm pretty sure the blast upset the monster population somehow.
All clear down this way.
We get the occasional monster here.
Wall Market's making bank, and it's all thanks to that bomb threat.
Yeah, I can see why─this shit would make anyone wanna drink till they puke.
Getting the sense you'd like to do the same.
You got me wrong. I'm a responsible member of society.
But seeing as I can't even get to work, might as well do something to pass the time.
So you're not gonna go get drunk?
Like I told you, I'm a working man with responsibilities. I need to hit the hay─got an early start tomorrow.
Miracles do happen.
On the other hand, the trains might not start up for a while. Might be I can't make it in...
That sure was something, seeing the reactor light up like that.
Maybe I'll go check to see if it's still on fire.
Hey, you're a SOLDIER, right!?
How is it that you guys still haven't caught Avalanche? Huh?
Just one night in Wall Market, and I'm broke. I blew through everything.
Think you can help me out─lend a guy some money?
I spent every last gil, even the extra bit I'd borrowed...
Think you can help me out─lend a guy some money?
Still aren't running, I take it?
Guess I'm not working today either.
I wonder if things'll be up and running tomorrow.
Nice sword you got.
Interested in joining the watch?
We make sure to patrol nights.
You'd be surprised how many come out after dark.
Huh? Headed for the station?
Trains aren't gonna so much as budge for a while.
That reactor bombing's gone and ruined our homecoming, hasn't it?
I just hope everyone's okay.
I'm glad I moved here, but...
This place takes getting used to.
I'm still not comfortable here after the sun goes down.
This place takes getting used to.
Just wanna go to bed.
I've been out here all night watching the fire.
So, do you think this means another war's coming?
Sure hope not.
Oh, hey there, Aerith.
Found yourself some arm candy!
Good evening to you.
Out for a stroll?
The station's just down here. Sector 7's the other way.
Huh? Where in the hell's that train station?
Town's over that way, so...
It's dark already? Ah man, I've been lost for hours!
Town's over that way, so...
H-hey! Who's that guy with you, Aerith?
How exactly d'you know Aerith?
Sure would love another one of your bouquets, Aerith!
Where you off to? Sector 7? Then you're going the wrong way.
How exactly d'you know Aerith?
Bodyguard, huh? Lucky bastard.
Heard you were some kinda merc or something.
Folks've got nothing but good things to say about you, my man. That Aerith's got a good eye when it comes to people.
Got any spare machine parts? Sell 'em here!
S-80 screws are in high demand, and we're paying top gil!
Shit, that wrench! It's priceless!
That form, that finish. Hot damn...
They weren't kidding around when they said this place was a friggin' scrap gold mine!
Man, the hinges on my front door are too goddamn squeaky. Almost as loud and annoying as the missus!
Easy fixes, both. Oil for the door, and a fancy night out for the wife.
Way ahead of ya. We're having dinner in Wall Market tonight.
Oh yeah? Then what's with the bitching?
Oh, hey, you mind cleaning this puppy up?
How's about swapping it out for a brand-new one? I'll give you good value on a trade-in!
Not happening. It's old faithful or bust!
Had it out with the wife the other day.
How am I gonna get her to forgive me?
My lights've been on the fritz ever since that explosion knocked out the power.
Could be the wiring, I reckon.
You mind taking a look-see?
Sure, but I give discounts to frequent buyers, y'know.
You're good!
I made it first through all the tires!
And I got first place in the race!
Very impressive! You each get a snack for doing so well.
Cactuar gum or chocobo candy? Ah man, how am I supposed to choose!?
I know! It's so tough!
No need to rush now. Take your time, kids.
I sure hope this cactuar gum's got a silver ticket inside!
A silver ticket means you get a piece for free!
And a golden one means a thousand free!
I've had enough chocobo candy.
You know 'bout fat chocobo candy?
Wait, what's that? I wanna try it! Gimme!
Just got in a big ol' shipment of fabric softener!
Get your hands on the hottest new scent: sunbathing chocobo!
Hey! What'll it be?
We gotta get that new Shinra sponge.
The one that's been on TV?
Yeah! They say it works miracles. No stain too tough!
Get the green one and you'll never need another sponge again.
You don't think there's mako in it or something, do ya?
Sponges really flew off the shelves today!
Commercials can sell anything, I tell ya.
C'mon, Dad. Where are you?
He promised to take me to see the reactor.
Wonder if I'd get in trouble if I went on my own.
Hey, did you see the reactor fire?
Can't believe someone'd do that to a reactor.
What a world. Why do we even bother, you know?
I can't skip work. Not again.
I wanna work─and I know I should─but tell that to my body.
What to do for dinner?
Should I head home...or swing by Wall Market?
A couple of drinks out would hit the spot right about now.
Should I head home...or swing by Wall Market?
Oh, who am I kidding. I don't have that kinda money to burn.
Straight on home it is...
So pretty!
I heard SOLDIERs have eyes that sparkle just like materia!
No way!
I want one.
I-I'll buy some for you when we're all grown up.
Really?
What about me?
Oh, uh... Um...sure.
You heard what they said on TV? Avalanche is working for Wutai.
But I thought we weren't fighting Wutai.
Shit. This is enough to keep anyone up at night...
Well, Shinra's not gonna take this lying down!
I can't wait to hear what the president has to say about it all.
Hope he gives a rousing speech─gets everybody fired up and ready to fight!
Gramps has been feeling a lot better ever since he heard about what happened.
He won't stop telling us stories about that damn reactor.
Things we'll need in an emergency...
Potions for sure, but how many?
Clerk here's not the friendliest of people, but she's got a good heart.
She's my first love─swept me right off my feet.
Look at her, playing coy...
So they still haven't caught 'em?
The hell's taking 'em so damn long!?
Better catch 'em soon.
Screw Avalanche and screw Wutai!
Is Sector 4 next on their hit list?
Scary shit.
What're those assholes gonna bomb next?
Hard to sleep when you don't know.
Why the hell would anyone do that?
Wutai's pulling their strings, you'll see.
Lock 'em up─lock 'em all up!
Avalanche is scum!
They crossed a line bombing a reactor.
They won't target the slums, right...?
Wonder what they'll bomb next...
It's all I can think about.
They're nothing but cowards!
What'll happen if war breaks out?
Does anyone know their next target?
Maybe war is inevitable...
We need to start preparing for the worst.
There could be a war any day now.
Didn't those Wutai dogs learn their lesson?
Wutai's clearly brainwashed 'em.
I knew deep down this day'd come eventually.
If I have to, I'm prepared to fight again.
Another war's comin' soon...
I'd be honored to fight for my home.
Midgar will stand strong!
Who's scared of Avalanche, anyway!?
We're not going to let them hurt Midgar anymore!
I'd do anything for this town.
I don't understand─the war is over!
I thought Wutai surrendered.
That Avalanche doesn't scare me!
We all need to help Shinra!
According to officials who are involved with the ongoing investigation...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: the bombers are believed to have gone into hiding somewhere far from the site of the attacks.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: A large-scale search led by military forces is currently being planned.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Furthermore, initial reports confirm that terrorists were coordinating their efforts with Wutai─
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: a revelation that has left many citizens shaken.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Though the cease-fire was declared five years ago, the scars are still fresh...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: as the children we interviewed earlier today─whose parents died in the war─will attest to.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Anti-Wutai sentiment has reached a fever pitch in the city as more information about their involvement comes to light...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: and amid this growing hostility, many believe that war is inevitable.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: These citizens are already gathering in Sector 2 for President Shinra's upcoming speech...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: hoping it will include a declaration of war.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: And now, the weather report.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: We're looking at another cloudy day in Midgar, with overcast skies through tomorrow.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: There's also a chance of rain in some areas.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: The emergency shelters in Sectors 1, 5, and 8...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: are filled with displaced residents whose homes have been damaged or destroyed.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: In an effort to aid the evacuees...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Shinra is considering offering units in its residential properties...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: to qualifying citizens, free of charge, until they can find new accommodations.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Many citizens throughout the city are also voicing their anger and outrage with Avalanche.
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: Instead of our regular programming...
data.speaker: Announcer

data.text: we will be bringing to you live the protest rally taking place tomorrow.

data.text: Everything that comes out of the president's mouth is complete bullshit.
But those eco-terrorists, "Avalanche" or "Avarice" or whoever.
It's not like they've earned my trust either.
They talk about wanting justice and all that, but it seems to me like they're just jealous of the people in power.
I wish I knew who to trust.
Well, I trust myself. Don't we all? I mean, I know that I would never lie to myself.
Whew, that's solid.
Actually, I was thinking of volunteering for the watch like you.
That's wonderful! Let's take down Avalanche together!
If a war does break out, think you'll enlist?
Of course. I'll do anything to protect the city I love.
TV's so boring.
Is it time for Stamp's adventures yet?
Those Avalanche guys are unbelievable! Without the reactors, how are we supposed to live?
We need to stand up and fight against anyone who tries to destroy our way of life.
Us folks in the neighborhood watch are talking about countermeasures.
You can count me in. I was in the military. I know a few things.
That was way too much...
Wall Market is a scary place...
Wall Market is the best place...
My head's killing me...
Spices are so important!
Exactly! They're what give the local cuisine the flavor you can't find anywhere else.
That's so true! No one else can get their food to taste quite like this.
The spices and herbs that are used are grown right here in the slums.
Freshly picked! That's the secret.
Really? Where can I find them?
Someone at the Leaf House might know.
Man, I can't decide where to go on my honeymoon.
I'd recommend Costa del Sol. Pretty famous resort town.
I really enjoyed my tour of the Shinra Building.
Do I need to make a reservation for that Shinra Building tour?
Nah. Just show up. The folks there'll take care of ya.
Wanna help me out too? What d'you say?
data.speaker: Restaurant Owner

data.text: Aerith is such a sweetheart.
data.speaker: Restaurant Owner

data.text: How 'bout it? You hungry?
data.speaker: Restaurant Owner

data.text: Aerith, drop by anytime!
data.speaker: Restaurant Owner

data.text: Hey. Looking for a new weapon?
I'd love to sell you something, but I don't work here. Talk to that guy. He does.
Buddy, I'm just a customer.
Anything else around here I can possibly use...?
Ooh! That's a fine-looking piece of scrap.
Gotta melt it down, find a use for it.
Will you look at that? I'm almost sober.
I guess it's time to hit Wall Market.
I'll try not to spend every gil I have.
That's what's called "easy money."
We even got to be on TV!
And to think, all we had to do was shit talk Avalanche behind that reporter.
Hey, let's get one thing straight. Everything I said? I meant it.
It'd be great if they asked us again.
'Cause of the money, or 'cause you'd get to be on TV again?
Remember my boyfriend in Sector 7? Well, we've decided to adopt from the orphanage.
So you're leaving?
Yeah, it's for the best.
We'll miss you around here.
I'll come visit when things settle down. This is still and always will be my home.
What are you doing up there!?
Get down here right this second!
It's not safe up there!
What if you fall and break your neck!?
How's this?
I'm not done yet!
Ta-da!
Phew.
Hey! Be a little more careful, will ya?
Yes, ma'am.
I don't think you're supposed to be that forceful.
Don't worry, I know what I'm doing.
So, same fee as always then?
Sounds good! A drink at the bar works for me.
My mom found out I played a mean trick.
She's really mad.
No dinner for me tonight...
I didn't mean to...
I just love the smell of that new fabric softener!
Oh, I know the one! It's chocobo scented.
Finally got power back after the explosion, but now my lights flicker.
My neighbor was dealing with the same thing. You should talk to the scrap dealer.
I tried that new chocobo fabric softener you mentioned.
Doesn't it smell heavenly?
Yeah, I suppose, but it's not strong enough to mask the smell of the water.
Did you end up talking to the scrap dealer about that problem with your lights?
He said it would be an issue until the reactor was stable again.
Of course this had to happen while I was visiting family.
I guess I should try to enjoy myself.
Might as well check out Wall Market while I'm down here.
Oh, and there was that joint in Sector 7. The one with the hot bartender. What was it called again? Seventh something?
You look like someone who can hold his own.
Wanna join the watch?
We're always looking for new recruits!
My boyfriend hasn't come home!
He's probably at that Honeybee Inn!
Have you heard of a shop called The Happy Turtle?
I found a flyer for the place, but apparently, it's not actually in Midgar?
With a name like that, I wonder what kind of stuff they sell.
We all need to be prepared for war. It's coming, whether we like it or not.
That Avalanche... They really have no idea who they've pissed off!
I'll fight Avalanche or Wutai or anyone else who wants to start shit!
Did you know? This place is haunted!
It's haunted!?
When rich people walk through here, their gil and jewels magically disappear!
Phew! Then we don't have to worry about anything.
Yeah!
Huh?
Whoa!
Then, you're really leaving?
I made a promise to... Umm... To the people I care about...
Hmm, acting is a lot harder than it looks.
Where are you, Jessie? Come home and help me soon.
Let's try and jump to the plate!
Let's jump!
I bet you didn't know, but the plate? It was built by our grandfathers!
Wow, really?
I wish I could've helped build the plate back then!
Yeah, me too!
I can't believe someone made the reactor explode! That's so scary!
Tell me, which do you like better: Shinra or Avalanche?
Uh huh, uh huh. Okay...
You're so fluffy!
I've been wondering... What should I be when I grow up?
My teacher thinks I'd make a great merchant, but I think joining the military is way cooler. Don't you think?
You're lucky. You don't have to think about this kinda stuff.
Long ago, when the Sector 6 plate fell, everybody thought it was the end.
The plate fell out of the sky?
Just that once─and it'll never happen again.
But after it happened, the town became a very dangerous place.
I know! You're talking about Wall Market, aren't you?
Now listen to me. You stay away from there, all right?
Years ago when I came to Midgar, the plate you see now was only halfway finished.
Really!?
Yep. I helped build the rest of it with these two hands.
You could see the sky?
Of course, it was there for the looking.
Who knew talking to the kids about the past would make me feel so...sentimental.
Take a good, long look at it.
We all helped build that magnificent steel sky.
When is it gonna get dark around here?
I've got plans tonight. Can't wait.
I don't know if you know it, but there's this awesome place called the Honeybee Inn.
I'll be there soon, my sweet little honeygirl darling!
Yup, you've got it.
Looking good there.
If you learn your ABCs, you can read any book!
Even the hard ones for grown-ups.
I'm studying so I can read a ton of books!
Biggs gave me a bunch of his favorites, and I'm gonna read them all.
Umm...
Is this right?
One day, I wanna grow up and be just like Jessie.
I love to study!
Isn't this good?
Please grow big and yummy!
As tall as the sky!
Someone told me that talking to them would help them grow bigger.
Hey, mister! Do you want one of these?
Once they're ready to eat, I'll bring some to your place, Aerith.
Hello! I hope you grow nice and big.
Hello! I hope you grow nice and yummy.
Hello! How are you today?
Hey, Aerith! I hope you like the vegetables we're growing.
Hey Aerith, why don't you talk to them too?
Bet you didn't know that the smell of flowers helps nourish your heart.
I need nourishment for my heart and my body.
Stop thinking of food so much!
It's almost dinner time, and I'm hungry...
Oh, Aerith! You're here!

data.text: I want a big sword so I can fight too.
I want to kill all the monsters!
I can still hear the sound of the reactor exploding...over and over again.
I was back on the battlefield...
I won't be sleeping tonight.
Are you working at this hour?

data.text: Don't push yourself too hard.
data.speaker: Housemother

data.text: I heard you're not a florist at all, that you're actually a mercenary?

data.text: The kids are talking about you like they've found themselves a new hero.

data.text: Try taking after Aerith and smiling more.

data.text: Young man, are you a SOLDIER?
You need to do something about that Avalanche, you hear?
When I was a young lad, I came to Midgar to help build the plate with everyone.
Those were good times.
Aerith! How are you doing, dear?
I'd love another one of your pretty bouquets.
Midgar wouldn't be Midgar without the plate and the reactors.
I wish I knew what those Avalanche people were thinking.
Hm, where is it?
I'm looking for a book on planetology.
A book written by... What was the author's name? Bugel-something?
When is the president going to make a speech?
I'm sick of watching the same damn thing.
Clean, clean, everything's clean!
The pay is a lot better than you'd think.
I love talking to these guys. They're great!
If you're not doing anything, would you mind chatting with these ladies?
I don't think I can listen to another one of their stories.
Everyone's good at heart, but sometimes, people get lost and stray from the path.
They become thieves and steal.
Some end up working for that Don Corneo.
Is there no saving them?
That nice boy who ended up working for Corneo... I used to think he would grow up and run his own shop.
He changed so much after his parents passed away.
Come on!
Go for it!
I know you can do it!
Don't give up!
But I wanna climb up there!
No, it's much too dangerous.
But I have to climb up there so people will like me and think I'm cool!
How do kids come up with these silly games?
Pretty please!
No.
I rule this town! Yeah─I'm the don!
Higher, higher, higher!
But I'm scared of the doggy...
Will he bite me?
Um, can I pet him?
Hi there, cute little doggy!
I don't think I know you. You don't look familiar.
Can I ask you something? Does the water's smell bother you?
I hear they've got filters over in Sector 7 that can get rid of it. You think they really work?
But...I've gotten used to it, though. Barely even notice it now.
Woosh, woosh, woosh!
Do you need to do laundry?
Ever notice that even if you wash your clothes they smell kinda funny?
If I hang this out, will it dry?
I can't believe it. He waited till now to tell me he had laundry.
He said he needs to wear it tomorrow, but that's not my problem.
Doubt it'll even be dry by then.
A man in black rags showed up. He was scary!

data.text: I hope this never happens again.

They were scared by the creepy dude in black.

Shh!
He doesn't see me. Be quiet!
What if they're attacked by monsters out there?
My friends will come back safe and sound, right?
"Alas, poor prince, I must confess, I am not from this planet."
"Then you must be from the legendary..." The legendary... Uh, what was the next line again?
Hey, wanna be in a play with me?
You can be my loyal knight.
Are you stronger than all the monsters?
Aerith, you have to save them, okay?
I wanna become strong just like you!

data.text: Oh, if only. Easier said than done.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: They're always on the move, looking for new adventures, chasing new dreams, all while trying to make the lives of everyone around them just a little bit better.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: I try to make sure they don't stumble and fall, and when they finally do, I help them back up.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: Sounds exhausting.

data.text: Sometimes it is.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: But I want the children to know that until they can stand on their own two feet that I'm here to support them, care for them, love them─
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: that even if we're not actually related, we're still a family─a real family, in all the ways that matter.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: If I can do that for them, then well...then maybe I'm making this world a better place.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text: I know you are.
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text:
My predecessor taught me everything I know.
I just took up his torch and ran with it, I guess.
data.speaker: Ms. Folia

data.text:
Not that I'm anything close to what he was.
Biggs is one of a kind.

data.text: Oh no! I've completely lost track of time!

data.text: It's always a pleasure to speak with those charming little ones from the Leaf House.
Like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
I thought we'd put those days of war and death behind us. But Wutai won't let us move on.
Oh my! Is that a moogle!?
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: You can see me, kupo? Then you two must be very, very special people. In that case...
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: Welcome to the Moogle Emporium! I'm the owner─Moggie!
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: You must not be familiar with "Mog the Moogle." It's a pretty famous fairy tale.
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: Mog wanted to bring happiness to all the moogles of the forest, so he decided to open a shop of wonders.
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: That's right, kupo! I opened a store to bring happiness to the slums─like Mog!
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: And you know, only people with the purest of hearts can even see moogles!

data.text: Uhh... You talking 'bout me?

data.text: Well...moogle magic isn't perfect, kupo.

data.text: They can be yours if you've got enough moogle medals. But you'll need to buy a membership first!
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: If you find any moogle medals, you can spend them here, kupo!
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: So, Moggie, what do you do with the medals we give you?

data.text: Oh, you know what! I use them to make everyone happy! That's the duty of every moogle!

data.text: Of course. Just like Mog the Moogle.

data.text: Welcome to the Moogle Emporium!
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: Welcome, kupo!

data.text: Good to see you, kupo!

data.text: See anything you like?

data.text: A pleasure as always, kupo!

data.text: Come back soon, kupo!

data.text: Leaving already?

data.text: Have a merry moogle day, kupo!

data.text:
Hey, you don't happen to have a key
to a graveyard, do you?

data.text: Good for you.

data.text: Good luck, guys!

data.text: Soon I'll be able to make everyone here super happy!

data.text: That's wonderful! So...like Mog the Moogle, you'll be able to make all our hopes and dreams come true?

data.text: Not just yours, kupo! The wishes of every single person in the slums!

data.text: That's a lotta wishes.

data.text: Lots of people in Midgar love to collect moogle medals, you know. They'll pay anything to get their hands on more!
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: I'm using the money to set up more shops all throughout the slums, kupo!
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: I'm giving jobs to the other kids and making life better for everyone here!
data.speaker: Moggie

data.text: And that's how I'll make everyone happy!

data.text: That's one way of doing it, kupo.

data.text: Uhhh...moogle magic, kupo?

data.text: Oh...

data.text: I'm gonna be straight with you, mister. That...was bad. Like, really bad. You need to step up your game!

data.text: Only one way to become a Whack-a-Box master: whack, whack, whack!
data.speaker: Sarah

data.text: We'll be here whenever you feel like playing!
data.speaker: Sarah

data.text: Come back again soon, okay? Pinky swear?

data.text: Ah, you wouldn't happen to be a certain merc that's become the talk of the town?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Yup.
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: I'm Damon. Little more than a humble reporter with the Daily Buzz.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Ugh, that rag? The one that's always printing awful rumors about the slums?
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: On the contrary, my dear!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: We strive to raise awareness of the plight of our undercity brethren.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: We seek a better future for everyone, rich and poor.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Now then, my friends. I find myself in need of your exceptional services for a trifling matter.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Are you familiar with the mysterious─and notorious─bandit known as the "Angel of the Slums"?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: She delivers written declarations to her victims─usually Shinra associates─before divesting them of their valuables.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Everyone knows her. Everything she steals, she gives to the poor and needy.
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: Yes. She's got a knack for public relations. Very popular down here as a result.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Nevertheless, she is a criminal and a threat to the public order!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: I've made it my mission to unmask the villain, but the locals have been uncooperative and uncommunicative, to put it mildly.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: And now that my identity as a reporter has been exposed, my sources have all deserted me!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Which brings me to you─the merc of the hour, and the man who will serve up my scoop!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: I'll welcome any and all information pertaining to the so-called Angel of the Slums.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: I'm sure the locals know much, much more than they're letting on.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Unmasking the Angel would be a huge scoop─and my editor would pay an immodest sum for the story, to say the least!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: What's that? The Guardian Angel of the Slums?
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Come to think of it, a reporter came sniffin' around askin' about her─you his man?
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Ha! Even if I knew something, I wouldn't tell you.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: To folks around here, the Angel is a hero! I ain't sellin' her out to Shinra!
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Why, hello! What is it?
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: The Guardian Angel of the Slums? Such a mysterious figure. Always talked about, but never seen by anyone!
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: The Angel gets in and out without being noticed and always leaves a calling card. Maybe a magician!?
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: No, no, it's no magic trick─it's genuine magic! Rumor has it that the Angel is a witch.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: If we're going by rumors, then I've heard that it's actually a monster in disguise.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Well, I could talk all day about the dozens of stories I've heard!
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: What? Do I know the Guardian Angel of the Slums?
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Well I don't know much, but I do know she doesn't steal from the poor and she doesn't kill anyone either.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Far as I'm concerned that's all I need to know.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: If that's not enough for ya, the one you oughta talk to is Mireille. Ask anyone and they'll tell ya she knows everything about everyone around here.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Can't believe you can get paid to dig up people's secrets. Even a bandit makes a more honest living than that reporter!
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: I'm sorry we didn't have any useful information to share.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Is that all you needed? If you want to hear about the latest rumors, I'd be happy to share.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: If I were you, I'd talk to Mireille. If anyone knows anything, it'd definitely be her.
data.speaker: Undercity Resident

data.text: Good to see you again, Mireille.
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: Good to see you too, Aerith. I'd heard you found yourself a funny new friend.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Cloud, meet Mireille. She knows everything there is to know about the slums.
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: Mireille, meet Cloud. He's a former SOLDIER, and super strong.
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: He looks useful enough.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: The kids have been talking about you. The defender of the secret hideout.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: And now the Hero of the Leaf House is helping the Daily Buzz look for the Angel of the Slums.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: I am?
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: I'm a lover of the whispered word. Not that it's any real secret, considering how chatty that Shinra mutt's been.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Not looking into it for the reporter. I'm doing it for myself. Call it curiosity...or whatever.
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: Or could it be you've fallen under the Angel's spell like so many others?
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Anyway─it so happens that I have some information for you.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: But I'll need a moment before I can give it to you. Why don't you wait with that reporter of yours?
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Just wait outside with the reporter. I'll be along soon.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: So! Any news?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Have you tried talking to Mireille at all? She told us that she had some information to share.
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: Mireille as in the Mireille? The town gossip?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: I chased her for days, begging for info, but she wouldn't give up a single scrap!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: So how'd you get the old bird to talk?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: This old bird had a change of heart, that's all.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Then quickly, before you have another, tell us: what do you know about the notorious Angel of the Slums?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Has she struck again? Is that it!?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: I don't know anything about that. But I do know where her hideout is.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Her base of operations? Now that's a scoop! Where is it!? Tell me!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Deep in the scrap─at Lookout Point. Hardly anyone goes out there these days. It's the perfect place for a criminal to hole up.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Lookout Point─got it! I'll check it out right now!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: But before you go, I should warn you about this rumor I heard─about a terrible fiend that's claimed the Angel's hideout as its lair.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Quite large, lots of teeth, always hungry. I don't know about you, but I'd not go anywhere near that thing.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Er, well, uh...
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Well! A good reporter knows never to take foolish risks. "Plan first, then act." That's every respectable journalist's motto!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: If it's a "plan" you're looking for, I'd say you have one right here. Wouldn't you?
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: So, my good mercenary. If I might impose upon you again, it would be lovely if you investigated Lookout Point for me.
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: The forgotten Lookout Point deep within the scrap. Could it be that this place holds the secrets of the Angel?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: This is what we need to find out!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: If you do happen to run afoul of any ravenous fiends, it would be lovely if you did something about it. For the truth!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: I promise I'll pay you once the job's complete. Just make sure you come back with good news─or any news!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Heard the monster up at Lookout Point ain't your average beastie. You be careful now.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Don't let that thing lay a claw on Aerith, you hear me?
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: This oughta be good. Best be on your way, merc.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Okay then. Guess we should look around.
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: "The Guardian Angel of the Slums will collect your offering on behalf of the poor."
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: This must be one of her calling cards!
data.speaker: Aerith

data.text: I don't see anything else interesting. Let's head back and tell them what we found.
data.speaker: Cloud

<color=yellow>The Angel of the Slums</color>

Return to the reporter?
data.speaker: Cloud

data.text: I can't believe it! You found one of her calling cards!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: This is the genuine article, I'm sure of it! Penned by the Angel herself!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Hmm... So this is one of her famous warnings.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: It's an incredible find! Oh─was that all?
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: Hold on.

data.text: Looks like there's something else─a message.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: "To the nosy Shinra reporter sniffing around...
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: "I was planning to teach you a lesson you would never forget. However, by the grace of your mercenary friend, you were spared that lesson.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: "But next time he might not be around to save you. You would be wise to watch your step."
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Not just a message from the Angel... A warning!
data.speaker: Damon

data.text: If the merc here hadn't bailed you out, that fiend in the scrap would've ripped you to shreds.
data.speaker: Mireille

data.text: Sorry about that, friend.
data.speaker: Mireille
